main

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.View

  • public class View
extends java.lang.Object
    The game view. This controls the view shaking when the player character falls from high up.
    Author:
    Gary Fleming, Logun DeLeon, Alex Duncanson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      View()
      A constructor that sets everything to default values.
      View(double x, double y, int w, int h)
      A constructor that allows you to set viewX, viewY, width, and height.

    • Constructor Detail

      • View

        public View()
        A constructor that sets everything to default values. All numerical values are set to 0. viewShaking is false.

      • View

        public View(double x,
            double y,
            int w,
            int h)
        A constructor that allows you to set viewX, viewY, width, and height.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of viewX.
        y - the value of viewY.
        w - the width of the view.
        h - the height of the view.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step()
        The actions taken by the view during each iteration of the game loop. Shakes the screen if necessary.

      • viewShake

        public void viewShake(int time,
                      int mag)
        View Shake ----------- Init the camera shake. Will change to a list later to allow for multiple shakes
        Parameters:
        time - the amount of time the screen shakes.
        mag - the magnitude that the screen shakes.
